channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Learning Semantic-Aware Knowledge Guidance for Low-Light Image Enhancement
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a novel semantic-aware knowledge-guided framework (SKF) that can assist a low-light enhancement model in learning rich and diverse priors encapsulated in a semantic segmentation model.

item.title: Weighted Siamese Network to Predict the Time to Onset of Alzheimer's Disease from MRI Images
item.description: We train a siamese network model to predict the time to onset of AD based on MRI brain images.

item.title: Instance-aware Dynamic Prompt Tuning for Pre-trained Point Cloud Models
item.description: To address this issue, we propose an Instance-aware Dynamic Prompt Tuning (IDPT) for point cloud pre-trained models, which utilizes a prompt module to perceive the semantic prior features of each instance.

item.title: Toward Real-Time Image Annotation Using Marginalized Coupled Dictionary Learning
item.description: We have employed a marginalized loss function in our method to leverage a simple and effective method of prototype updating.

item.title: SEA: A Scalable Entity Alignment System
item.description: To enhance the usability of GNN-based EA models in real-world applications, we present SEA, a scalable entity alignment system that enables to (i) train large-scale GNNs for EA, (ii) speed up the normalization and the evaluation process, and (iii) report clear results for users to estimate different models and parameter settings.

item.title: FairRec: Fairness Testing for Deep Recommender Systems
item.description: Given the testing report, by adopting a simple re-ranking mitigation strategy on these identified disadvantaged groups, we show that the fairness of DRSs can be significantly improved.

item.title: PARFormer: Transformer-based Multi-Task Network for Pedestrian Attribute Recognition
item.description: Pedestrian attribute recognition (PAR) has received increasing attention because of its wide application in video surveillance and pedestrian analysis.

item.title: DCFace: Synthetic Face Generation with Dual Condition Diffusion Model
item.description: Our novel Patch-wise style extractor and Time-step dependent ID loss enables DCFace to consistently produce face images of the same subject under different styles with precise control.

item.title: SimpLex: a lexical text simplification architecture
item.description: Thus, the main contributions of this paper are: (1) We propose a new Word Embedding and Transformer based algorithm for text simplification; (2) We design \textsc{SimpLex} -- a modular novel text simplification system -- that can provide a baseline for further research; and (3) We perform an in-depth analysis of our solution and compare our results with two state-of-the-art models, i. e., LightLS [19] and NTS-w2v [44].

item.title: Multimodal C4: An Open, Billion-scale Corpus of Images Interleaved With Text
item.description: We release Multimodal C4 (mmc4), an augmentation of the popular text-only c4 corpus with images interleaved.

item.title: AutoSplice: A Text-prompt Manipulated Image Dataset for Media Forensics
item.description: To achieve this, we propose a new approach that leverages the DALL-E2 language-image model to automatically generate and splice masked regions guided by a text prompt.

item.title: Learn What Is Possible, Then Choose What Is Best: Disentangling One-To-Many Relations in Language Through Text-based Games
item.description: Language models pre-trained on large self-supervised corpora, followed by task-specific fine-tuning has become the dominant paradigm in NLP.

item.title: BCE-Net: Reliable Building Footprints Change Extraction based on Historical Map and Up-to-Date Images using Contrastive Learning
item.description: This contrastive learning strategy allowed us to inject the semantics of buildings into a pipeline for the detection of changes, which is achieved by increasing the distinguishability of features of buildings from those of non-buildings.

item.title: Uncertainty-Aware Null Space Networks for Data-Consistent Image Reconstruction
item.description: This can be achieved either by iterative network architectures or by a subsequent projection of the network reconstruction.

item.title: Performative Prediction with Neural Networks
item.description: In this work, we instead assume that the data distribution is Lipschitz continuous with respect to the model's predictions, a more natural assumption for performative systems.

item.title: Cultural-aware Machine Learning based Analysis of COVID-19 Vaccine Hesitancy
item.description: Our findings show that Hispanic and African American are most likely impacted by cultural characteristics such as religions and ethnic affiliation, whereas the vaccine trust and approval influence the Asian communities the most.

item.title: WYTIWYR: A User Intent-Aware Framework with Multi-modal Inputs for Visualization Retrieval
item.description: Retrieving charts from a large corpus is a fundamental task that can benefit numerous applications such as visualization recommendations. The retrieved results are expected to conform to both explicit visual attributes (e. g., chart type, colormap) and implicit user intents (e. g., design style, context information) that vary upon application scenarios.

item.title: HuaTuo: Tuning LLaMA Model with Chinese Medical Knowledge
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs), such as the LLaMA model, have demonstrated their effectiveness in various general-domain natural language processing (NLP) tasks.

item.title: TUM-FAÇADE: Reviewing and enriching point cloud benchmarks for façade segmentation
item.description: Point clouds are widely regarded as one of the best dataset types for urban mapping purposes.

item.title: Spectral Transfer Guided Active Domain Adaptation For Thermal Imagery
item.description: We propose an active domain adaptation method in order to examine the efficiency of combining the visible spectrum and thermal imagery modalities.

item.title: Self-Supervised Learning based Depth Estimation from Monocular Images
item.description: Depth Estimation has wide reaching applications in the field of Computer vision such as target tracking, augmented reality, and self-driving cars.

item.title: Bitstream-Corrupted JPEG Images are Restorable: Two-stage Compensation and Alignment Framework for Image Restoration
item.description: In this paper, we study a real-world JPEG image restoration problem with bit errors on the encrypted bitstream.

item.title: L1BSR: Exploiting Detector Overlap for Self-Supervised Single-Image Super-Resolution of Sentinel-2 L1B Imagery
item.description: Unfortunately the lack of reliable high-resolution (HR) ground truth limits the application of deep learning methods to this task.

item.title: A Byte Sequence is Worth an Image: CNN for File Fragment Classification Using Bit Shift and n-Gram Embeddings
item.description: File fragment classification (FFC) on small chunks of memory is essential in memory forensics and Internet security.

item.title: CoSDA: Continual Source-Free Domain Adaptation
item.description: Recently, SFDA has gained popularity due to the need to protect the data privacy of the source domain, but it suffers from catastrophic forgetting on the source domain due to the lack of data.

item.title: Canonical and Noncanonical Hamiltonian Operator Inference
item.description: A method for the nonintrusive and structure-preserving model reduction of canonical and noncanonical Hamiltonian systems is presented.

item.title: Segment Everything Everywhere All at Once
item.description: Inspired by the development of prompt-based universal interfaces for LLMs, this paper presents SEEM, a promptable, interactive model for Segmenting Everything Everywhere all at once in an image.

item.title: DDT: Dual-branch Deformable Transformer for Image Denoising
item.description: Transformer is beneficial for image denoising tasks since it can model long-range dependencies to overcome the limitations presented by inductive convolutional biases.

item.title: AGIEval: A Human-Centric Benchmark for Evaluating Foundation Models
item.description: Impressively, GPT-4 surpasses average human performance on SAT, LSAT, and math competitions, attaining a 95% accuracy rate on the SAT Math test and a 92. 5% accuracy on the English test of the Chinese national college entrance exam.

item.title: Towards hypergraph cognitive networks as feature-rich models of knowledge
item.description: Semantic networks provide a useful tool to understand how related concepts are retrieved from memory.

item.title: You are here! Finding position and orientation on a 2D map from a single image: The Flatlandia localization problem and dataset
item.description: We introduce Flatlandia, a novel problem for visual localization of an image from object detections composed of two specific tasks: i) Coarse Map Localization: localizing a single image observing a set of objects in respect to a 2D map of object landmarks; ii) Fine-grained 3DoF Localization: estimating latitude, longitude, and orientation of the image within a 2D map.

item.title: Neural State-Space Models: Empirical Evaluation of Uncertainty Quantification
item.description: Effective quantification of uncertainty is an essential and still missing step towards a greater adoption of deep-learning approaches in different applications, including mission-critical ones.

item.title: Priors for symbolic regression
item.description: In this paper we develop methods to incorporate detailed prior information on both functions and their parameters into SR. Our prior on the structure of a function is based on a $n$-gram language model, which is sensitive to the arrangement of operators relative to one another in addition to the frequency of occurrence of each operator.

item.title: Revisiting the thorny issue of missing values in single-cell proteomics
item.description: While the field is still actively debating on the best practices, the challenge increased with the emergence of mass spectrometry-based single-cell proteomics and the dramatic increase in missing values.

item.title: Zoom-VQA: Patches, Frames and Clips Integration for Video Quality Assessment
item.description: Video quality assessment (VQA) aims to simulate the human perception of video quality, which is influenced by factors ranging from low-level color and texture details to high-level semantic content.

item.title: A Learnheuristic Approach to A Constrained Multi-Objective Portfolio Optimisation Problem
item.description: The results of this study show that, despite taking significantly longer to run to completion, the learnheuristic algorithms outperform the baseline algorithms in terms of hypervolume and rate of convergence.

item.title: Sign Language Translation from Instructional Videos
item.description: We report a result of 8. 03 on the BLEU score, and publish the first open-source implementation of its kind to promote further advances.

item.title: Learning Accurate Performance Predictors for Ultrafast Automated Model Compression
item.description: On the contrary, we obtain the optimal efficient networks by directly optimizing the compression policy with an accurate performance predictor, where the ultrafast automated model compression for various computational cost constraint is achieved without complex compression policy search and evaluation.

item.title: RadarGNN: Transformation Invariant Graph Neural Network for Radar-based Perception
item.description: However, the sparsity of radar point clouds and the poor data availability remain challenging for current perception methods.

item.title: Improving Segmentation of Objects with Varying Sizes in Biomedical Images using Instance-wise and Center-of-Instance Segmentation Loss Function
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel two-component loss for biomedical image segmentation tasks called the Instance-wise and Center-of-Instance (ICI) loss, a loss function that addresses the instance imbalance problem commonly encountered when using pixel-wise loss functions such as the Dice loss.

item.title: Neuromorphic Event-based Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: Recently, event cameras have shown large applicability in several computer vision fields especially concerning tasks that require high temporal resolution.

item.title: A Study of Biologically Plausible Neural Network: The Role and Interactions of Brain-Inspired Mechanisms in Continual Learning
item.description: Humans excel at continually acquiring, consolidating, and retaining information from an ever-changing environment, whereas artificial neural networks (ANNs) exhibit catastrophic forgetting.

item.title: STU-Net: Scalable and Transferable Medical Image Segmentation Models Empowered by Large-Scale Supervised Pre-training
item.description: However, the state-of-the-art models for medical image segmentation are still small-scale, with their parameters only in the tens of millions.

item.title: MProtoNet: A Case-Based Interpretable Model for Brain Tumor Classification with 3D Multi-parametric Magnetic Resonance Imaging
item.description: Recent applications of deep convolutional neural networks in medical imaging raise concerns about their interpretability.

item.title: Level generation for rhythm VR games
item.description: The assignment is broken down into three parts: determining the timing of the beats (action placement), determining where in space the runes connected with the chosen beats should be placed (action selection) and web-application creation.

item.title: Remote Sensing Change Detection With Transformers Trained from Scratch
item.description: Current transformer-based change detection (CD) approaches either employ a pre-trained model trained on large-scale image classification ImageNet dataset or rely on first pre-training on another CD dataset and then fine-tuning on the target benchmark.

item.title: DGNN-Booster: A Generic FPGA Accelerator Framework For Dynamic Graph Neural Network Inference
item.description: The experiment results demonstrate that DGNN-Booster can achieve a speedup of up to 5. 6x compared to the CPU baseline (6226R), 8. 4x compared to the GPU baseline (A6000) and 2. 1x compared to the FPGA baseline without applying optimizations proposed in this paper.

item.title: Boosting Convolutional Neural Networks with Middle Spectrum Grouped Convolution
item.description: This paper proposes a novel module called middle spectrum grouped convolution (MSGC) for efficient deep convolutional neural networks (DCNNs) with the mechanism of grouped convolution.

item.title: Noisy Correspondence Learning with Meta Similarity Correction
item.description: Despite the success of multimodal learning in cross-modal retrieval task, the remarkable progress relies on the correct correspondence among multimedia data.

item.title: Robust Multiview Multimodal Driver Monitoring System Using Masked Multi-Head Self-Attention
item.description: Driver Monitoring Systems (DMSs) are crucial for safe hand-over actions in Level-2+ self-driving vehicles.
